001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.annotation.JourneyData;
004import io.qameta.allure.internal.shadowed.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude;
005import io.qameta.allure.internal.shadowed.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
006import io.qameta.allure.internal.shadowed.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature;
007import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
008import java.lang.reflect.Array;
009import java.lang.reflect.Field;
010import java.lang.reflect.InaccessibleObjectException;
011import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
012import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014import java.util.Collection;
015import java.util.Collections;
016import java.util.IdentityHashMap;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Map;
019import java.util.Objects;
020import java.util.Set;
021import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
022import java.util.stream.Collectors;
023import java.util.stream.IntStream;
024import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext;
025
026/**
027 * Utility class for formatting objects and their fields into various string representations.
028 *
029 * <p>Provides methods to format object fields, collections, arrays, generate HTML content from data,
030 * format annotations, process responses, and format journey data.
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
034 */
035public final class ObjectFormatter {
036
037   /**
038    * Cache for storing declared fields of classes.
039    */
040   private static final ConcurrentHashMap<Class<?>, Field[]> FIELDS_CACHE = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
041
042   /**
043    * ObjectMapper instance configured for JSON formatting.
044    */
045   private static final ObjectMapper OBJECT_MAPPER = createObjectMapper();
046
047
048   private ObjectFormatter() {
049   }
050
051
052   /**
053    * Creates and configures an ObjectMapper with specific serialization settings.
054    *
055    * @return a configured ObjectMapper instance
056    */
057   private static ObjectMapper createObjectMapper() {
058      ObjectMapper mapper = new ObjectMapper();
059      mapper.setSerializationInclusion(JsonInclude.Include.NON_NULL);
060      mapper.enable(SerializationFeature.INDENT_OUTPUT);
061      return mapper;
062   }
063
064
065   /**
066    * Formats the fields of the provided object into a string representation.
067    * Uses a set to detect circular references.
068    *
069    * @param obj the object whose fields will be formatted
070    * @return a formatted string representing the object's fields
071    */
072   public static String formatObjectFields(Object obj) {
073      return formatObjectFields(obj, Collections.newSetFromMap(new IdentityHashMap<>()));
074   }
075
076
077   /**
078    * Recursively formats the fields of the provided object, tracking visited objects to avoid circular references.
079    *
080    * @param obj     the object to format
081    * @param visited a set of already visited objects to prevent infinite recursion
082    * @return a formatted string representation of the object's fields
083    */
084   @SuppressWarnings("java:S3011")
085   private static String formatObjectFields(Object obj, Set<Object> visited) {
086      if (obj == null) {
087         return "null";
088      }
089      if (visited.contains(obj)) {
090         return "[Circular Reference Detected]";
091      }
092      visited.add(obj);
093
094      Class<?> objClass = obj.getClass();
095      if (objClass.getPackageName().startsWith("java.") || objClass.isEnum()) {
096         visited.remove(obj);
097         return obj.toString();
098      }
099
100      StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder(objClass.getSimpleName()).append(" {\n");
101      try {
102         for (Field field : FIELDS_CACHE.computeIfAbsent(objClass, Class::getDeclaredFields)) {
103            boolean isStatic = Modifier.isStatic(field.getModifiers());
104            Object target = isStatic ? null : obj;
105            if (!field.canAccess(target)) {
106               try {
107                  field.setAccessible(true);
108               } catch (InaccessibleObjectException e) {
109                  result.append(field.getName()).append(": [Inaccessible Field]\n");
110                  continue;
111               }
112            }
113            result.append(field.getName()).append(": ")
114                  .append(formatArgumentValue(field.get(obj), visited))
115                  .append("\n");
116         }
117      } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
118         result.append("[Error accessing fields]");
119      }
120      result.append("}");
121      visited.remove(obj);
122      return result.toString();
123   }
124
125
126   /**
127    * Formats a single argument value, handling primitive types, collections, arrays, or objects.
128    *
129    * @param argument the argument value to format
130    * @param visited  a set of visited objects for circular reference detection
131    * @return a string representation of the argument value
132    */
133   private static String formatArgumentValue(Object argument, Set<Object> visited) {
134      if (argument == null) {
135         return "null";
136      }
137      if (argument instanceof String || argument instanceof Number || argument instanceof Boolean) {
138         return argument.toString();
139      }
140      if (argument instanceof Collection<?>) {
141         return formatCollection((Collection<?>) argument, visited);
142      }
143      if (argument.getClass().isArray()) {
144         return formatArray(argument, visited);
145      }
146      return formatObjectFields(argument, visited);
147   }
148
149
150   /**
151    * Formats a collection of objects into a comma-separated string representation.
152    *
153    * @param collection the collection to format
154    * @param visited    a set of visited objects for circular reference detection
155    * @return a string representation of the collection elements
156    */
157   private static String formatCollection(Collection<?> collection, Set<Object> visited) {
158      return collection.stream()
159            .map(element -> formatArgumentValue(element, visited))
160            .collect(Collectors.joining(", "));
161   }
162
163
164   /**
165    * Formats an array of objects into a comma-separated string representation.
166    *
167    * @param array   the array to format
168    * @param visited a set of visited objects for circular reference detection
169    * @return a formatted string representation of the array elements
170    */
171   private static String formatArray(Object array, Set<Object> visited) {
172      int length = Array.getLength(array);
173      return IntStream.range(0, length)
174            .mapToObj(i -> formatArgumentValue(Array.get(array, i), visited))
175            .collect(Collectors.joining(", ", "[", "]"));
176   }
177
178
179   /**
180    * Generates HTML content by loading an HTML template and replacing placeholders with formatted argument rows.
181    *
182    * @param arguments a map of Enum keys to LinkedList of objects representing arguments
183    * @return a string containing the generated HTML content
184    */
185   public static String generateHtmlContent(Map<Enum<?>, List<Object>> arguments) {
186      String htmlTemplate = ResourceLoader.loadResourceFile("allure/html/test-data.html");
187      return htmlTemplate.replace("{{argumentRows}}", buildRowsFromMap("", arguments));
188   }
189
190
191   /**
192    * Builds HTML table rows from a map of arguments.
193    *
194    * @param label a label used to filter certain keys (e.g. "PreArguments")
195    * @param map   the map containing argument data
196    * @return a string containing HTML table rows
197    */
198   private static String buildRowsFromMap(String label, Map<Enum<?>, List<Object>> map) {
199      if ("PreArguments".equals(label)) {
200         return "";
201      }
202      return map.entrySet().stream()
203            .filter(entry -> entry.getValue() != null && !entry.getValue().isEmpty())
204            .map(entry -> String.format("<tr><td>%s</td><td>%s</td></tr>",
205                  entry.getKey(), formatObject(entry.getValue())))
206            .collect(Collectors.joining());
207   }
208
209
210   /**
211    * Formats a linked list of objects by concatenating their formatted field representations.
212    *
213    * @param objects the linked list of objects to format
214    * @return a string representation of the formatted objects
215    */
216   private static String formatObject(List<Object> objects) {
217      return objects == null || objects.isEmpty() ? "" :
218            objects.stream()
219                  .filter(Objects::nonNull)
220                  .filter(obj -> !obj.getClass().getName().contains("Lambda"))
221                  .map(ObjectFormatter::formatObjectFields)
222                  .collect(Collectors.joining(", "));
223   }
224
225
226   /**
227    * Escapes HTML special characters in the provided input string.
228    *
229    * @param input the string to escape
230    * @return the escaped string suitable for HTML display
231    */
232   public static String escapeHtml(String input) {
233      return input == null ? "N/A" : input.replace("&", "&amp;")
234            .replace("<", "&lt;")
235            .replace(">", "&gt;")
236            .replace("\"", "&quot;")
237            .replace("'", "&#39;")
238            .replace("%", "%%");
239   }
240
241
242   /**
243    * Retrieves and formats annotations present on the test class associated with the provided extension context.
244    *
245    * @param context the JUnit extension context containing test class information
246    * @return a string containing formatted class annotations or a message if none are found
247    */
248   public static String getClassAnnotations(ExtensionContext context) {
249      String annotations = Arrays.stream(context.getRequiredTestClass().getAnnotations())
250            .map(annotation -> "@" + annotation.annotationType().getSimpleName()
251                  + (annotationHasArguments(annotation)
252                  ? formatAnnotationArguments(annotation) : ""))
253            .collect(Collectors.joining("\n"));
254
255      return annotations.isEmpty() ? "No class annotations" : annotations;
256   }
257
258
259   /**
260    * Retrieves and formats annotations present on the test method associated with the provided extension context.
261    *
262    * @param context the JUnit extension context containing test method information
263    * @return a string containing formatted method annotations
264    */
265   static String getMethodAnnotations(ExtensionContext context) {
266      return Arrays.stream(context.getRequiredTestMethod().getAnnotations())
267            .map(ObjectFormatter::formatAnnotation)
268            .collect(Collectors.joining("\n"));
269   }
270
271
272   /**
273    * Formats an annotation into a string including its simple name and any arguments.
274    *
275    * @param annotation the annotation to format
276    * @return a string representation of the annotation
277    */
278   private static String formatAnnotation(Annotation annotation) {
279      String annotationName = annotation.annotationType().getSimpleName();
280      String arguments = formatAnnotationArguments(annotation);
281
282      return "@" + annotationName + (arguments.isEmpty() ? "" : arguments);
283   }
284
285
286   /**
287    * Determines whether the provided annotation has any arguments.
288    *
289    * @param annotation the annotation to check
290    * @return true if the annotation has arguments, false otherwise
291    */
292   private static boolean annotationHasArguments(Annotation annotation) {
293      return Arrays.stream(annotation.annotationType().getDeclaredMethods())
294            .anyMatch(method -> {
295               try {
296                  Object defaultValue = method.getDefaultValue();
297                  Object actualValue = method.invoke(annotation);
298                  return defaultValue == null || !defaultValue.equals(actualValue);
299               } catch (IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException | SecurityException e) {
300                  return false;
301               } catch (Exception e) {
302                  throw new IllegalStateException("Unexpected exception occurred while processing annotation", e);
303               }
304            });
305   }
306
307
308   /**
309    * Formats the arguments of an annotation into a comma-separated string enclosed in parentheses.
310    *
311    * @param annotation the annotation whose arguments will be formatted
312    * @return a string representation of the annotation's arguments
313    */
314   private static String formatAnnotationArguments(Annotation annotation) {
315      List<String> args = Arrays.stream(annotation.annotationType().getDeclaredMethods())
316            .map(method -> {
317               try {
318                  Object value = method.invoke(annotation);
319                  if (value.getClass().isArray()) {
320                     value = Arrays.toString((Object[]) value)
321                           .replace("[", "")
322                           .replace("]", "")
323                           .replace(",", "");
324                  }
325                  if (value.equals(method.getDefaultValue())) {
326                     return "";
327                  }
328                  return method.getName() + "=" + value;
329               } catch (IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException | SecurityException e) {
330                  return method.getName() + "=error";
331               } catch (Exception e) {
332                  throw new IllegalStateException("Unexpected exception occurred while formatting annotation arguments",
333                        e);
334               }
335            })
336            .filter(arg -> !arg.isEmpty())
337            .toList();
338
339      return args.isEmpty() ? "" : args.stream().collect(Collectors.joining(", ", "(", ")"));
340   }
341
342
343   /**
344    * Formats a string of annotations into HTML rows with proper indentation.
345    *
346    * @param annotations the raw annotations string to format
347    * @return a string containing HTML formatted annotations
348    */
349   static String formatAnnotationsToNewRows(String annotations) {
350      if (annotations == null || annotations.trim().isEmpty()) {
351         return "None";
352      }
353      String[] annotationList = annotations.split("(?=@{1,2})");
354
355      StringBuilder formattedAnnotations = new StringBuilder("<pre class='annotation'>");
356      int indentLevel = 0;
357
358      for (String annotation : annotationList) {
359         if (annotation.trim().isEmpty()) {
360            continue;
361         }
362
363         String cleanedAnnotation = cleanAnnotation(annotation);
364         String indentedAnnotation = applyIndentation(cleanedAnnotation, indentLevel);
365
366         formattedAnnotations.append(getIndent(indentLevel)).append(indentedAnnotation).append("\n");
367
368         indentLevel += countOccurrences(indentedAnnotation, "{") + countOccurrences(indentedAnnotation, "[");
369         indentLevel -= countOccurrences(indentedAnnotation, "}") + countOccurrences(indentedAnnotation, "]");
370      }
371
372      formattedAnnotations.append("</pre>");
373      return formattedAnnotations.toString();
374   }
375
376
377   /**
378    * Cleans the annotation string by removing package names and unnecessary formatting.
379    *
380    * @param annotation the raw annotation string
381    * @return a cleaned annotation string
382    */
383   private static String cleanAnnotation(String annotation) {
384      return annotation.trim()
385            .replace("io\\.cyborgcode\\.roa\\.framework\\.annotation\\.", "")
386            .replace("<", "&lt;")
387            .replace(">", "&gt;")
388            .replace("\n\n", "\n")
389            .replaceAll("value\\s*=\\s*", "")
390            .replaceAll("late\\s*=\\s*false,?", "")
391            .replaceAll("order\\s*=\\s*\\d+,?", "")
392            .replaceAll("useJavaDoc\\s*=\\s*false,?", "")
393            .replaceAll("@Description\\(([^)]+)\\)", "@Description(\"$1\")")
394            .replace("\n", "")
395            .replaceAll("requestUrlSubStrings\\s*=\\s*\\[([^]]+)]", "requestUrlSubStrings = [$1]");
396   }
397
398
399   /**
400    * Applies indentation to the provided text based on the base indent level,
401    * formatting braces and commas appropriately.
402    *
403    * @param text            the text to format
404    * @param baseIndentLevel the base level of indentation
405    * @return the text with applied indentation
406    */
407   private static String applyIndentation(String text, int baseIndentLevel) {
408      return text
409            .replace("\\{", "{\n" + getIndent(baseIndentLevel + 1))
410            .replace("}", "\n" + getIndent(baseIndentLevel) + "}")
411            .replace("\\[", "[\n" + getIndent(baseIndentLevel + 1))
412            .replace("]", "\n" + getIndent(baseIndentLevel) + "]")
413            .replace(",", ",\n" + getIndent(baseIndentLevel + 1))
414            .replaceAll("\n\\s*\n", "\n");
415   }
416
417
418   /**
419    * Generates a string containing spaces for indentation.
420    *
421    * @param level the number of indent levels to generate
422    * @return a string representing the indentation (each level consists of 4 spaces)
423    */
424   private static String getIndent(int level) {
425      return "    ".repeat(level);
426   }
427
428
429   /**
430    * Counts the number of occurrences of a target substring within a given string.
431    *
432    * @param str    the string to search in
433    * @param target the substring to count
434    * @return the count of occurrences of the target in the string
435    */
436   private static int countOccurrences(String str, String target) {
437      return str.length() - str.replace(target, "").length();
438   }
439
440
441   /**
442    * Formats a long text into multiple lines with a maximum of 80 characters per line, escaping HTML characters.
443    *
444    * @param text the text to format
445    * @return a string with formatted long text
446    */
447   static String formatLongText(String text) {
448      if (text == null || text.trim().isEmpty()) {
449         return "None";
450      }
451
452      text = text.replace("<", "&lt;")
453            .replace(">", "&gt;");
454
455      String[] words = text.split("\\s+");
456      StringBuilder formattedText = new StringBuilder();
457      StringBuilder currentLine = new StringBuilder();
458
459      for (String word : words) {
460         if (currentLine.length() + word.length() > 80) {
461            formattedText.append(currentLine.toString().trim()).append("<br>");
462            currentLine = new StringBuilder();
463         }
464         currentLine.append(word).append(" ");
465      }
466
467      formattedText.append(currentLine.toString().trim());
468      return formattedText.toString();
469   }
470
471
472   /**
473    * Retrieves the test method's argument types from the provided extension context.
474    *
475    * @param context the JUnit extension context containing test instance and method information
476    * @return a string listing the test method's argument types or a message if none are available
477    */
478   static String getTestArguments(ExtensionContext context) {
479      return context.getTestInstance()
480            .flatMap(instance -> context.getTestMethod()
481                  .map(method -> Arrays.stream(method.getParameters())
482                        .map(param -> param.getType().getSimpleName())
483                        .collect(Collectors.joining(", "))))
484            .orElse("No arguments available.");
485   }
486
487
488   /**
489    * Formats processed journey data along with the corresponding original data into a readable string.
490    *
491    * @param originalData  an array of JourneyData annotations associated with the data
492    * @param processedData an array of processed data objects corresponding to the original data
493    * @return a formatted string representing the processed journey data
494    */
495   public static String formatProcessedData(JourneyData[] originalData, Object[] processedData) {
496      if (processedData == null || processedData.length == 0) {
497         return "No data available";
498      }
499
500      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
501      sb.append("Processed Journey Data:\n");
502      sb.append("-------------------\n");
503
504      for (int i = 0; i < processedData.length; i++) {
505         Object data = processedData[i];
506         String journeyDataValue = extractJourneyDataValue(originalData[i]);
507
508         sb.append(String.format("Journey: %s%n", journeyDataValue));
509
510         if (data == null) {
511            sb.append("  Data: null\n");
512         } else {
513            formatJsonData(sb, data);
514         }
515
516         if (i < processedData.length - 1) {
517            sb.append("\n");
518         }
519      }
520
521      return sb.toString();
522   }
523
524
525   /**
526    * Extracts the value from a JourneyData annotation.
527    *
528    * @param journeyData the JourneyData annotation
529    * @return the value contained in the annotation
530    */
531   private static String extractJourneyDataValue(JourneyData journeyData) {
532      return journeyData.value();
533   }
534
535
536   /**
537    * Formats an object as JSON using the configured ObjectMapper and appends it to the provided StringBuilder.
538    * If JSON formatting fails, falls back to calling the object's toString method.
539    *
540    * @param sb   the StringBuilder to append the formatted JSON to
541    * @param data the data object to format as JSON
542    */
543   private static void formatJsonData(StringBuilder sb, Object data) {
544      try {
545         String formattedJson = OBJECT_MAPPER.writeValueAsString(data);
546         String[] jsonLines = formattedJson.split("\n");
547         for (String line : jsonLines) {
548            sb.append("  ").append(line).append("\n");
549         }
550      } catch (Exception e) {
551         sb.append("  Data: ").append(data.toString()).append("\n");
552      }
553   }
554
555}
